basics.name: Nicholas Wagner
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: After receiving my B.S. in Computer Science from Vanderbilt University, I began my career as a Software Engineer at Insurance Sales Lab. I was exposed to new and interesting technologies and was forced to learn quickly, adapt, and hit deadlines. I enjoy solving complex problems using various technologies like React, TypeScript, and AWS. Collaborating with teams who embrace agile processes is important to me, and I thrive in fast-paced environments. I am a high-potential candidate with significant upside and I have demonstrated an ability to overcome a lack of knowledge and experience through dedication and effort. I oppose the 9-5 and want to work somewhere that motivates me to come earlier and stay later in order to achieve the company's goals, make deadlines, and maximize my own professional development.

work.name: Freelance
work.description: Designing and building web applications for small business
highlights: Led the redesign of a yacht chartering service’s website, utilizing Next.js 13 framework and modern web technologies to transform Figma designs into a powerful web application
Implemented Google Cloud Sheets API to quickly develop a Contact form, utilizing service accounts and secure credential management
Leveraged Google Cloud CDN to efficiently serve large volumes of images and videos on the /gallery pages, enhancing user experience and performance

work.name: Insurance Sales Lab
highlights: Utilized Agile software development daily with employees from multiple sectors, working together to develop the best product and meet deadlines in a fast-paced startup environment

Built data models, front-end dashboard, and access guards to remodel the customer subscriptions platform from end-to-end, enabling a month-to-month subscription option that increased enterprise engagement by 10%

Designed and engineered a server-side object cache leveraging TypeScript object types, GraphQL APIs, and Postgres PubSub listeners decreasing Prisma database reads by 40% when rendering a user’s landing page
Implemented JSON Schema into our codebase and converted the schema into TypeScript types, resulting in a 50% reduction in data processing errors and a strongly typed and validated data model
Automated SSL certificate management to customers by integrating Google Cloud’s Certificate Manager API framework into the codebase, decreasing each client onboarding meeting by one hour

work.name: American Airlines Open Source
highlights: Developed an API using TypeScript and the Express framework to generate random flight information based on a given airport code by forking the American Airlines flight-engine repository and addressing an open issue
Implemented Jest unit testing to thoroughly validate API functionality resulting in a 95% code coverage and a 30% increase in overall test coverage

work.name: Unwind
highlights: Implemented dynamic styling and animations for the application login UI, utilizing Swift to create a seamless user experience that matched the company's design vision

Developed and implemented a delete functionality for user posts in the app, collaborating with the design team to transform Figma designs into a responsive and intuitive UI, consistent with company branding and standards

projects.name: API Security Enhancement Project
projects.description: A TypeScript script that leverages Resy.com’s API network to automate restaurant bookings to explore API security
highlights: Conducted an in-depth analysis of the security posture of a prominent restaurant reservation booking website's APIs, identifying potential vulnerabilities and weaknesses
Employed reverse-engineering methodologies to deconstruct and comprehend the inner workings of the APIs, uncovering critical security gaps

Developed a custom cybersecurity toolset leveraging Node.js and Postman to perform rigorous testing and validation of API endpoints, meticulously scrutinizing headers, and assessing authentication mechanisms
